title: Police: Peoria teens' shooting was over drug deal, not electronics sale
content:
Peoria police say two teens who shot each other Wednesday night had been trying to conduct a drug transaction.
Officer Amanda Gaines said indications are that the two shot each other after a disagreement during the meeting not far behind the QuikTrip at 75th Avenue and Deer Valley Road.
Police who were called to the scene found a 15-year-old boy walking out of a river bottom area with a gunshot wound. An 18-year-old male was found with two gunshot wounds in the 7400 block of West Hillcrest Road in Glendale.
They were both transported to a trauma center with non-life-threatening injuries. The teens remained hospitalized Thursday, Gaines said.
Police initially were told the two were meeting to complete a private sale of an electronic device.
